description: The CodeBoarding system orchestrates a comprehensive code analysis and documentation generation workflow. It begins with the Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager initializing projects, managing code repositories, and detecting changes. This orchestrator leverages the Incremental Analysis Engine to optimize performance by caching and re-analyzing only modified code. The core intelligence resides in the LLM Agent Core, which uses large language models to interpret code and analysis results. The agent interacts with the codebase and static analysis data through the Agent Tooling Interface, which in turn queries the Static Code Analyzer for deep structural and behavioral insights. Finally, the LLM Agent's findings are passed to the Documentation & Diagram Generator to produce user-friendly documentation and visual architectural diagrams.

components.name: Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager
components.description: Manages the overall application lifecycle, including project initialization, repository operations (cloning, updating), change detection, and orchestrating the analysis workflow. It also handles the initial setup and environment configuration for the analysis tools.

components.name: CLI Orchestrator
components.description: The primary controller that parses command‑line arguments, validates the environment, and sequences the high‑level pipeline flow.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Handles Git operations including cloning, branch switching, and local filesystem path resolution for the target project.

components.name: Change Detector
components.description: Identifies modified files between analysis runs to enable incremental processing and optimize LLM usage.

components.name: Tool Registry & Provisioner
components.description: Manages the lifecycle, installation, and discovery of LSP servers (Python/TS) and binary tools like Tokei.

components.name: Job State Manager
components.description: Tracks the status (started, finished, error) and metadata of analysis tasks to support concurrency and recovery.

components.name: Ignore Engine
components.description: Implements complex filtering logic (e.g., .gitignore patterns) to exclude non‑essential files from the analysis scope.

components.name: Environment Configurator
components.description: Provides centralized access to application constants, path resolution, and configuration overrides.

components_relations.relation: triggers tool verification and installation
commands to fetch or update target codebase
initializes and updates job records
utilizes to calculate diffs
passes file lists through to filter
queries for installation paths and version constants
queries previous job metadata

components.name: LLM Agent Core
components.description: The intelligent core responsible for driving the code analysis and documentation generation using large language models. It orchestrates agent workflows, manages interactions with various tools, and structures the analysis insights.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: Central supervisor that manages the analysis lifecycle, file classification, and depth planning, coordinating prompts and delegating tasks to specialized agents.

components.name: Prompt Registry & Factory
components.description: Decoupled system for generating provider‑specific system messages and task templates, interfacing with LLM infrastructure for correct prompt formatting.

components.name: Specialized Analysis Agents
components.description: Suite of agents (Meta, Abstraction, Details) that perform domain‑specific interpretation of code facts, querying the static analysis bridge and populating data models.

components.name: Validation Engine
components.description: Feedback loop that cross‑references LLM‑generated insights against the ground‑truth CFG to prevent hallucinations and informs the orchestrator of failures.

components.name: Architectural Data Models
components.description: Pydantic schemas defining the contract layer for inter‑agent communication and final insight representation.

components.name: Static Analysis Bridge
components.description: Utility layer that provides agents with filtered, relevant facts from the raw CFG and dependency graphs.

components.name: LLM Infrastructure
components.description: Manages multi‑provider configurations, API authentication, and shared runtime constants.

components_relations.relation: triggers specific analysis phases
requests filtered CFG data and dependency clusters
compares LLM‑generated component maps against actual CFG facts
signals validation failures to trigger re‑analysis or correction loops
retrieves provider‑specific constants for prompt payloads
populates structured schemas with interpreted data

components.name: Static Code Analyzer
components.description: Performs deep structural and behavioral analysis of the codebase across multiple programming languages. It extracts information like call graphs, code structure, and identifies code quality issues, including unused code.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Coordinates project scanning, language detection, and the overall analysis lifecycle, acting as the entry point for the subsystem.

components.name: LSP Infrastructure
components.description: Provides the JSON-RPC transport layer and symbol resolution logic to communicate with external Language Servers.

components.name: Incremental Manager
components.description: Optimizes performance by using Git diffs to perform delta-analysis, updating only changed fragments of the graph.

components.name: Language Adapters
components.description: Language‑specific bridges (Java, TypeScript, etc.) that handle environment discovery and map LSP data to domain models.

components.name: Graph Construction Engine
components.description: Transforms raw symbol and call data into a unified Call Graph and performs architectural clustering.

components.name: Analysis Result Store
components.description: Central DTO and persistence layer containing the extracted CFG, class hierarchies, and package dependencies.

components.name: Health & Quality Runner
components.description: Orchestrates the execution of diagnostic checks and aggregates findings into a repository‑wide health score.

components.name: Code Quality Diagnostics
components.description: Suite of specialized checkers (e.g., UnusedCodeAnalyzer, God Class) that evaluate the graph for structural issues.

components_relations.relation: initializes
supplies
forwards
provides
persists
orchestrates
queries
finalizes

components.name: Agent Tooling Interface
components.description: Provides a set of specialized tools that allow the LLM Agent Core to interact with the codebase, query static analysis results, and perform specific actions within the project context.

components.name: Tool Registry & Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central factory and dispatcher; it aggregates all specialized tools into a unified interface, managing tool registration and lifecycle for the LLM Agent.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Extracts high-level code intelligence, including Control Flow Graphs (CFG), class hierarchies, and method signatures to provide structural understanding.

components.name: File System & Source Access
components.description: Provides low-level access to the project's physical structure, enabling directory exploration and granular file content retrieval.

components.name: Dependency & Ecosystem Mapper
components.description: Maps internal package relationships and identifies external library dependencies to define the project's architectural boundaries.

components.name: Documentation & Git Context Provider
components.description: Retrieves non-code context, such as Markdown documentation and Git diffs, to provide historical grounding and design intent.

components.name: Infrastructure & State Manager
components.description: Manages repository-level state, including the DuckDB metadata store, caching mechanisms, and global ignore-pattern enforcement.

components_relations.relation: dispatches complex code queries to specialized extractors
requests raw file data or directory listings
queries the metadata store and cache
utilizes class and package info to build high-level dependency graphs
consults ignore-pattern enforcement
uses file discovery to locate relevant files

components.name: Incremental Analysis Engine
components.description: Optimizes analysis performance by managing the caching of static analysis results and orchestrating re-analysis only for changed parts of the codebase, ensuring efficiency and speed.

components.name: Incremental Orchestrator
components.description: The central controller that drives the update pipeline, coordinates sub‑components, and performs final integrity validation.

components.name: Change Impact Analyzer
components.description: Quantifies structural shifts using similarity metrics and classifies changes into categories (e.g., structural vs. internal).

components.name: Analysis State Manager
components.description: Manages the persistence and retrieval of historical analysis artifacts (call graphs, hierarchies) from the cache.

components.name: Update Strategy Router
components.description: Evaluates "dirty" components to decide between a lightweight patch or a full AI‑driven re‑analysis.

components.name: Lightweight Patcher
components.description: Executes fast‑path updates for file renames or moves by patching internal manifests and analysis files.

components.name: Agentic Re-expansion Engine
components.description: Orchestrates LLM‑based agents to re‑document components that have undergone significant structural changes.

components.name: File-Component Mapper
components.description: Maintains the alignment between physical source files and the abstract architectural components defined in the cache.

components.name: Incremental Schema
components.description: Defines the shared domain language (ChangeImpact, UpdateAction) used to communicate state across the engine.

components_relations.relation: requests a delta analysis to classify the scope of repository changes
retrieves the "last known good" state to calculate similarity thresholds
passes identified "dirty" components to determine the most efficient update path
triggers manifest updates when changes are limited to file paths or metadata
triggers LLM re-analysis when code logic or structural boundaries shift significantly
persists newly generated AI summaries and updated call graphs to the cache
updates file references in the persistent store without re-running analysis
resolves modified file paths to their corresponding architectural clusters

components.name: Documentation & Diagram Generator
components.description: Transforms the processed analysis data and insights into user-friendly documentation formats (e.g., Markdown, HTML) and generates visual representations like architectural diagrams.

components.name: Execution Controller
components.description: The subsystem entry point that validates the environment, parses configuration, and triggers the high-level analysis and rendering pipeline. It acts as the bridge between the user (CLI/GitHub Actions) and the internal logic.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: The central coordinator that manages the analysis lifecycle. It handles the transition from raw repository data to structured architectural models and coordinates incremental updates.

components.name: Manifest Manager
components.description: Maintains the persistent mapping between source code files and discovered architectural components. It ensures that the analysis is reproducible and consistent across runs.

components.name: Coverage Tracker
components.description: Handles change detection and tracks which files require re-analysis. It provides the granularity needed for performance‑optimized incremental builds.

components.name: Markdown Generator
components.description: Transforms the internal analysis model into static Markdown files, primarily utilizing Mermaid.js for architectural diagrams.

components.name: HTML Generator
components.description: Produces interactive documentation using Cytoscape.js for dynamic, browser‑based architectural visualizations.

components.name: Sphinx Generator
components.description: Generates reStructuredText (RST) files specifically designed for integration into the Sphinx documentation ecosystem.

components.name: MDX Generator
components.description: Emits React‑compatible documentation (MDX) with metadata front‑matter for modern web‑based documentation platforms (e.g., Docusaurus).

Orchestrator initiates analysis workflow, leveraging incremental updates based on detected code changes.
Orchestrator passes project context and triggers the main analysis workflow for the LLM Agent.
Incremental engine requests static analysis for specific code segments (new or changed).
Static analyzer provides analysis results to the incremental engine for caching.
LLM Agent invokes specialized tools to interact with the codebase and analysis data.
Agent tools query the static analysis engine for detailed code insights.
Static analysis engine provides requested data to the agent tools.
LLM Agent delivers structured analysis insights for documentation and diagram generation.
